meanings.definition: A slow, steady pace of running or trotting.
meanings.sent1: The horse moved in a jogtrot around the field.
meanings.sent2: She preferred a jogtrot during her morning run.
meanings.sent3: The jogtrot of the old dog always made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: His heart beat in a jogtrot, matching the rhythm of his steps.
meanings.sent5: The jogtrot of the turtle was a peaceful sight in the garden.

meanings.definition: To move at a slow, steady pace.
meanings.sent1: The elderly man would jogtrot along the path every day.
meanings.sent2: She jogtrotted through the park, enjoying the fresh air.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to jogtrot instead of sprinting for once.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to jogtrot by as she waited for the bus.
meanings.sent5: The river jogtrotted through the valley, never rushing.

meanings.sent1: His job felt like a never-ending jogtrot of paperwork.
meanings.sent2: The daily jogtrot of chores was starting to wear her out.
meanings.sent3: The jogtrot of the clock ticking became oddly comforting.
meanings.sent4: Life's jogtrot can sometimes be broken by unexpected surprises.
meanings.sent5: The jogtrot of the train on the tracks lulled him to sleep.
